revised_title: Sidnie Milana Manton: A Pioneering Zoologist and Biologist
tldr: Sidnie Milana Manton was a renowned zoologist and biologist who made significant contributions to the study of crustaceans and natural history. She was a trailblazer for women in science, becoming one of the first two sisters elected to the Royal Society. Manton's research took her to Tasmania and the Great Barrier Reef, where she conducted groundbreaking work on primitive syncarid crustaceans and contributed to the understanding of ecosystems. Her dedication to her craft and her ability to overcome personal challenges made her a role model for future generations of scientists.
